name: py-tensorflow

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: jemalloc
variants.description: Build with jemalloc as malloc support

variants.name: gcp
variants.description: Build with Google Cloud Platform support

variants.name: hdfs
variants.description: Build with Hadoop File System support

variants.name: aws
variants.description: Build with Amazon AWS Platform support

variants.name: kafka
variants.description: Build with Apache Kafka Platform support

variants.name: dynamic_kernels
variants.description: Build kernels into separate shared objects

description:
An Open Source Machine Learning Framework for Everyone. TensorFlow is an
end-to-end open source platform for machine learning. It has a
comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries, and community
resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML and
developers easily build and deploy ML-powered applications. TensorFlow
was originally developed by researchers and engineers working on the
Google Brain team within Google's Machine Intelligence Research
organization to conduct machine learning and deep neural networks
research. The system is general enough to be applicable in a wide
variety of other domains, as well.

dependencies.name: llvm-amdgpu
dependencies.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.

dependencies.name: hsa-rocr-dev
dependencies.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.

dependencies.name: hip
dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: bazel
dependencies.description:
Bazel is an open-source build and test tool similar to Make, Maven, and
Gradle. It uses a human-readable, high-level build language. Bazel
supports projects in multiple languages and builds outputs for multiple
platforms. Bazel supports large codebases across multiple repositories,
and large numbers of users.

dependencies.name: swig
dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-absl-py
dependencies.description:
This repository is a collection of Python library code for building
Python applications. The code is collected from Google's own Python code
base, and has been extensively tested and used in production.

dependencies.name: py-astunparse
dependencies.description:
An AST unparser for Python. This is a factored out version of unparse
found in the Python source distribution; under Demo/parser in Python 2
and under Tools/parser in Python 3.

dependencies.name: py-flatbuffers
dependencies.description:
The FlatBuffers serialization format implemented in Python. For a
faster and feature-complete version check out the C++ implementation in
`flatbuffers` package.

dependencies.name: py-gast
dependencies.description: Python AST that abstracts the underlying Python version

dependencies.name: py-google-pasta
dependencies.description: pasta is an AST-based Python refactoring library.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: py-keras-preprocessing
dependencies.description: Utilities for working with image data, text data, and sequence data.

dependencies.name: py-libclang
dependencies.description:
The repository contains code that taken from the LLVM project, to make
it easier to install clang's python bindings.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-opt-einsum
dependencies.description: Optimized Einsum: A tensor contraction order optimizer.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-protobuf
dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.

dependencies.name: protobuf
dependencies.description: Google's data interchange format.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-termcolor
dependencies.description: ANSII Color formatting for output in terminal.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-wrapt
dependencies.description: Module for decorators, wrappers and monkey patching.

dependencies.name: rocrand
dependencies.description:
The rocRAND project provides functions that generate pseudo-random and
quasi-random numbers.

dependencies.name: rocblas
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute BLAS library

dependencies.name: rocfft
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute FFT library

dependencies.name: hipfft
dependencies.description:
hipFFT is an FFT marshalling library. Currently, hipFFT supports either
rocFFT or cuFFT as backends.hipFFT exports an interface that does not
require the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. It sits
between the application and the backend FFT library, marshalling inputs
into the backend and results back to the application.

dependencies.name: rccl
dependencies.description:
RCCL (pronounced "Rickle") is a stand-alone library of standard
collective communication routines for GPUs, implementing all-reduce,
all-gather, reduce, broadcast, and reduce-scatter.

dependencies.name: hipsparse
dependencies.description:
hipSPARSE is a SPARSE marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends

dependencies.name: hipcub
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependencies.name: rocsolver
dependencies.description:
rocSOLVER is a work-in-progress implementation of a subset of LAPACK
functionality on the ROCm platform.

dependencies.name: rocprim
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependencies.name: miopen-hip
dependencies.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.

dependencies.name: rocminfo
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) Runtime rocminfo tool

dependencies.name: py-grpcio
dependencies.description: HTTP/2-based RPC framework.

dependencies.name: py-tensorboard
dependencies.description:
TensorBoard is a suite of web applications for inspecting and
understanding your TensorFlow runs and graphs.

dependencies.name: py-astor
dependencies.description:
astor is designed to allow easy manipulation of Python source via the
AST.

dependencies.name: py-backports-weakref
dependencies.description: Backports of new features in Python's weakref module

dependencies.name: py-keras-applications
dependencies.description:
Sample Deep Learning application in Keras. Keras depends on this package
to run properly.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: mkl
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: curl
dependencies.description:
cURL is an open source command line tool and library for transferring
data with URL syntax

dependencies.name: cudnn
dependencies.description:
NVIDIA cuDNN is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural
networks

dependencies.name: nccl
dependencies.description: Optimized primitives for collective multi-GPU communication.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
Intel MPI. This package has been replaced by intel-oneapi-mpi. LICENSE
INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software, you agree to the
terms and conditions of the software license agreements at
https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark
dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-deepsig-biocomp
dependent_to.description:
DeepSig - Predictor of signal peptides in proteins based on deep
learning

dependent_to.name: py-keras
dependent_to.description:
Deep Learning for humans. Keras is a deep learning API written in
Python, running on top of the machine learning platform TensorFlow. It
was developed with a focus on enabling fast experimentation. Being able
to go from idea to result as fast as possible is key to doing good
research.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-estimator
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Estimator is a high-level TensorFlow API that greatly
simplifies machine learning programming.

dependent_to.name: py-medaka
dependent_to.description:
medaka is a tool to create consensus sequences and variant calls from
nanopore sequencing data. This task is performed using neural networks
applied a pileup of individual sequencing reads against a draft
assembly. It provides state-of-the-art results outperforming sequence-
graph based methods and signal-based methods, whilst also being faster.

dependent_to.name: py-alphafold
dependent_to.description:
AlphaFold is an AI system developed by DeepMind that predicts a
protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence. It regularly
achieves accuracy competitive with experiment.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-probability
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.
